page.title: 07Fremington Parish Council
page.content: The parish council does all kinds of things.They help other councils by giving advice about things like planning, which they know about because they are local people. They write letters to other councils when they want things done in the village. Sometimes people are co-opted onto the parish council and others get voted on. Mr. Metcalfe, the chairman of our school governors, was co-opted. Elections are held every four years. Few people vote. Many of our parents knew little about the parish council when we asked them about it. The parish council does not have much to do with rates. Two of the governors of our primary school are on the parish council. They are Mr. Metcalfe and Mr. Moody.
